hypothesis_content.title: Momentum Compression Breakout in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, when BTC's 10-day historical volatility drops into its lowest quartile (compression) and is simultaneously trading within 2% of its 20-day high, a breakout above that 20-day high will lead to sustained short-term momentum.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low volatility in a neutral market suggests consolidation and building energy. Proximity to highs indicates latent bullish bias. A clean breakout from this compression in a neutral regime can trigger momentum as sidelined capital reacts to the resolution of indecision.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day HV ranks in the bottom 25% for the last 90 days
BTC price is > 98% of its 20-day high
BTC price breaks and closes above its 20-day high

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7-day holding period OR a close below the 10-day SMA, whichever comes first
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close below the breakout candle's low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The average return over the 7 days post-breakout is not significantly greater than zero, or the win rate is below 55%.
